Steps.Message: Update at 18:44 - Originally, we believed this issue to be a fault on our network, but we have been made aware that due to some grounded overhead cabling, our engineers have had to turn power off remotely in the interest of public safety. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 21:00 and 22:00. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

We became aware of this power cut at 18:25. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Logs.Comment: Update at 18:44 - Originally, we believed this issue to be a fault on our network, but we have been made aware that due to some grounded overhead cabling, our engineers have had to turn power off remotely in the interest of public safety. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 21:00 and 22:00. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We had to turn off power in your area so our engineers could safely carry out emergency repairs to the network.
